name: echoic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
like or related to an echo (= a sound that is heard after it has been reflected off a surface such as a wall or a cliff): I listened to the strange echoic noises of the empty night-time station. The album is full of echoic hymn-like melodies.
language
  specialized (of a word) sounding similar to the noise the word refers to: Echoic words like "pop" and "bang" imitate the sound of what they are describing. The nightingale's name is not imitative of its cry, although the ending "-gale" is related to "yell", which is certainly echoic. Synonym
onomatopoeic Related word
echo
More examplesFewer examplesAn echoic rhyme repeats the last syllable of the line with which it rhymes.The poem has a structure of echoic repetitions.
